DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective post market clinical follow-up ( PMCF ) investigation evaluate performance safety fast gel dress use intend Diabetic Foot Ulcer ( DFU ) . The primary endpoint Changes baseline condition peri-wound skin measure following variable ; maceration , redness/irritation , rash/eczema , blistering , dermatitis , skin stripping , trauma wound edge product degradation skin
DOC.brief_title: Open , Non-comparative , Multi-centre Post Marketing Clinical Follow-up Investigation Evaluate Performance Safety Diabetic Foot Ulcer , DFU When Using Fast Gelling Dressing Intended .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Both gender ≥18 year old . 2 . Subjects type 1 2 diabetes mellitus . 3 . Texas Grade A1 2 , C1 2 4 . Exuding diabetic foot ulcer 5 . Ulcer localisation ; ankle 6 . Signed Informed Consent . 1 . Known allergy/hypersensitivity dress . 2 . HbA1c ≥ 10 % ( 86 mmol/mol ) ( recent value within 3 month ) 3 . Wound infection require systemic treatment 4 . Subjects problem follow protocol . 5 . Subjects include ongoing clinical investigation present past 30 day . 6 . Toe pressure le 70 mmHg 7 . Clinical suspicion osteomyelitis ( base probe bone/radiological change ) 8 . Dry wound
